channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: There is various potholes over both sides of the hill, 1st February
item.description:
The potholes are very deep and require urgent attention and they could cause an accident
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cleanthus Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant Rubbish outside Delaney House, 1st February
item.description:
There is constantly rubbish being fly tipped outside Delaney House. Recently someone moved into a flat within the block and emptied the contents here - mattresses, furniture, the works. Vans pull in in the night and drop off stuff. Is there anything that can be done to prevent this? It is a shame for the people that live here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thames Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The traffic lights outside Kilburn park Station by the Zebra crossing both sides of the road all out. This is very dangerous, 1st February
item.description:
Traffic Lights outside Kilburn Park station all out. This is very dangerous . People do not know when to cross.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Cambridge Avenue, Queen's Park, Greater London

item.title: 2 abandoned caravans on Eade Rd, n4, 1st February
item.description:
See pic. 1st caravan was parked for several months on the other side of barrier on Eade Rd, just past barrier at the Linkway. It moved for a week and is now where the picture has been taken and now back for at least a month. It was reported at least twice before and no action taken. Traffic warden on scooter said they can’t give it a ticket. 2nd caravan appeared this week. Both need to be removed as clearly the first has attracted attention/ word gotren around that the council don’t take action. This is v frustrating.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Eade Road, Harringay, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin and fly tipping, 1st February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aylesbury Road, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: The light is not working outside my home, 1st February

item.title: Graffiti Selborne Road for removal please, 1st February
item.description:
Previously reported under FixMyStreet ref: 8658358 on 9th January 2026!!! Graffiti 1) NOSE black acoustic wall Morrisons (car park side), 2) MALDOG Red Danger door in Morrisons car park, 3) MAFIOSO on tree opposite side of road and on lamp post - both bordering walkway into Allendale Close entrance by 74 Allendale Close. Could these all be removed please. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daneville Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Miss paid collection, 1st February
item.description:
Paid for fridge collection. Claimed it was colllected on the 05/12/2025. Unfortunately this is not true and is still in the same place on the 01/02/2026. As this has been paid for would it be possible to have it collected. Please find photos and screen shots for reference.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queensgate Mews, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 2A Brondesbury Road, 1st February

item.title: Children pouring paint and writing on exteriors at 21 Whiston Road, 1st February
item.description:
At 31st Jan, 2026, around 5:14pm near 21 Whiston Road, E2 8EX. Three children found cans of paint and kicked it on the pavement. One of them used paint to vandalize building walls. The cans rolled towards the road and cars drove over, which was dangerous.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
